fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: This question focuses on the extent to which public officials generally abide by the law and treat like cases alike, or conversely, the extent to which public administration is characterized by arbitrariness and biases (i.e., nepotism, cronyism, or discrimination). The question covers the public officials that handle the cases of ordinary people. If no functioning public administration exists, the lowest score (0) applies.
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_question: Are public officials rigorous and impartial in the performance of their duties?

fxInfo_responses.value: The law is not respected by public officials. Arbitrary or biased administration of the law is rampant.
The law is weakly respected by public officials. Arbitrary or biased administration of the law is widespread.
The law is modestly respected by public officials. Arbitrary or biased administration of the law is moderate.
The law is mostly respected by public officials. Arbitrary or biased administration of the  law is limited.
The law is generally fully respected by the public officials. Arbitrary or biased administration of the law is very limited.

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
